title: Six-year-old girl shot dead in drive by shooting in Cleveland
text:
Lyric Melodi Lawson was sleeping inside her house in Cleveland when she was fatally shot on Saturday at about 1am

A sleeping six-year-old girl has been fatally shot in the head after a gunman opened fire on her family home in a drive-by shooting.

Lyric Melodi Lawson was sleeping inside her house in Cleveland when she was shot on Saturday at about 1am.

The little girl was rushed to hospital with a gunshot wound to the head where she was pronounced dead.

Police said they are still investigating the shooting.

It is not yet clear if anyone else was injured.

They believe the gunman opened fire on the home before fleeing in a dark colored car.

Lyric's uncle, Davell Lawson, told WEWS that the family was lost for words.

'She's a fun going girl. She has two sisters. She's the middle child, they hang out every day,' he said of his slain niece.

Police believe the gunman opened fire on the home (above) where Lyric was sleeping on Saturday before fleeing in a dark colored car

'They love their grandparents, they love their parents. They love their aunties, uncles. They're just regular kids.

'All I want to know is who would do something like this?'

Lyric's aunt Corday Lawson took to Facebook to plead for anyone with information to come forward.

'We want justice if you heard something say it if you seen something say it this is a baby the street code is out the window she didn't deserve this we don't deserve this,' she wrote.

A vigil is planned to take place in honor of Lyric on Monday night.

Her friends and family plan to walk from the little girl's elementary school to her home where she was killed.
description: Six-year-old Lyric Melodi Lawson was sleeping inside her house in Cleveland when she was shot on Saturday at about 1am.
